channel.title: Javascript on bulletprooftoupee
channel.description: Recent content in Javascript on bulletprooftoupee

item.title: Dryp: A remote garden manager
item.description: This project is to fulfill a couple ends. The first is purely for professional development and add new and relevant work to my portfolio. The idea is to create a “mock” product and run it through from basic concept to a finished product complete w/ screen designs, work flows, functional and technical specs. While it may never see the light of day in terms of a real, functional product, I think that, as a project demonstrating the breadth of my abilities it will be apparent.

item.title: Canvas Workings
item.description: We want to put the canvas as a whole big background image… It might be prudent or useful to put a custom scss shortcode here as well?

item.title: Getting Gulp and Others
item.description: What do you need gulp.js for anyway? The whole point is to learn a few things, where to start? I suppose with fundamentals. I’ve been avoiding JS for years. It was in the early 2000’s when I came across a JS book and I did some examples and ran through the chapters. None of it stuck. I blamed it on poor writing and inadequate documentation. Really, though, I couldn’t grok some of the concepts and gave up.
